title: Byron 2014 Rita's Crown Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Winemaker Jonathan Nagy's new program includes sourcing from iconic sites around Santa Barbara County, like this vineyard high above the Santa Ynez River. The wine's deep mulberry aromas meet with hickory smoke and miso-like umami notes on the nose. Cranberry fruit shows on the palate, with nori and roasted pork accents.

title: Cambiata 2015 Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Round dark strawberry, mulberry and pound cake aromas show on the nose of this appellation blend from winemaker Eric Laumann. Bright raspberry and strawberry fruits show on the palate, lifted by sage and bay leaf notes and framed by a structure of mouth-cleansing tannins.

title: Wakefield 2015 Promised Land Cabernet Sauvignon (South Australia)
description: For the price, this is an impressively detailed and complex wine. Floral notes reminiscent of lavender or rosemary mark the nose and impart interest to the palate, which deftly marries herbs, baking spices and dark fruit. Crisp acids combine with soft tannins on the silky finish. Drink now–2022.

title: 9 Mile Road 2013 Shiraz (Langhorne Creek)
description: Don't expect explosive fruit from this wine. It delivers a pungent, spicy mix of cola, roasted meat and black olives instead, cushioned by ample weight in the mouth and a broad, creamy texture. Drink now–2020.

title: Abiqua Wind 2015 Caleb Knorr Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)
description: Classic flavors of pear flesh, along with a touch of Poire William liqueur, are the highlights here. It's a stylish, clean and persistent wine, that should be enjoyed within a couple of years of the vintage.

title: André Kientzler 2014 Kirchberg Grand Cru Muscat (Alsace)
description: The nose gives next to nothing away: there are the faintest hints of Damask rose. The palate is fluid and has concentrated tingling and zesty spice. There is a slightly bitter, richer texture and a very lemony fresh finish.

title: Arbor Brook 2014 Heritage Cuvée Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)
description: A mix of Dijon and Pommard clones, this offers a tart tangy fruit mix of cranberry, plum and sour cherry. There's a touch of freshly squeezed orange in the assertive acidity, and the impression is of a young, sassy, bright, forward, and juicy wine set up to go with roast fowl and a side of cranberry sauce.

title: Bernardus 2014 Rosella's Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Minerality is the focus on the nose of this bottling, with slate and earthy clay notes bolstering plum skin and cinnamon stick aromas. Graphite-like character enwraps the palate, where wet earth flavors meet with black raspberry and garrigue.

title: Bonterra 2015 Made With Organic Grapes Sauvignon Blanc (California)
description: Fresh and vibrant grapefruit, lemon and crisp apple aromas join equally lively citrus flavors in this medium-bodied, not-too-tart wine. It's refreshing and clean, pairing especially well with seafood.

title: Boscarelli 2012 Sotto Casa  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)
description: Ripe black-skinned berry, plum, new leather and balsamic aromas lift out of the glass. The polished palate shows red berry, oak, espresso and licorice notes, framed by fine-grained tannins that leave a firm finish. Drink 2020–2027.

title: Museum 2012 Reserva Tempranillo (Cigales)
description: Ripe berry aromas are a bit raisiny, with vanilla and balsam wood notes. This Tempranillo feels blocky, saturated and tannic. Flavors of raisin, prune, blackberry and wood spice are full and bullish, while a boundary-pushing finish maintains a palpable raisiny quality. Drink through 2020.

title: Romeo 2013  Vino Nobile di Montepulciano
description: Steeped plum and chopped herb scents lead the nose and follow through to the rather lean palate, which is marked by red cherry and a hint of star anise. Youthfully assertive tannins provide a firm finish. This needs a few more years to come around.

title: La Cave des Vignerons de Pfaffenheim 2015 Black Tie White (Alsace)
description: The nose is both supple and rich with its suggestion of ripe pear. The palate exemplifies the freshness of Riesling with its citrus overtones and is grounded by the textural richness of Pinot Gris. This is a rather successful blend of these two varieties, bringing ample freshness, texture and fruit. The finish is clean and dry.
winery: La Cave des Vignerons de Pfaffenheim

title: Noble Vines 2015 446 Chardonnay (San Bernabe)
description: The aromas on this widely available Delicato Family bottling—nectarine, chamomile and chalk—are subtle but approachable. It's well hewn on the palate, with touches of butter, baking spice, poached Asian pear and wafts of smoke.

title: Stable Hill 2016 The Unicorn Sauvignon Blanc (Adelaide Hills)
description: Starting from the nose of struck flint and white grapefruit, this wine sets up as a cheerful refresher. Riper notes of melon and stone fruit creep in on the palate, adding complexity without distracting from the medium body or silky texture, then finishing long and harmoniously. Drink now.

title: Thomas Goss 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (McLaren Vale)
description: Dense and rich, this is a hearty dry red for near-term drinking. Black olive and espresso aromas give way to chocolate and dark berries on the palate, while the finish is velvety and warm.

title: Salcis 2009 Reserva  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Gritty earthy aromas come up short on freshness and clarity. This feels raw and pinching, with dry rubbing tannins. Gritty peppery berry flavors are oaky, while this finishes with savory berry, herb and tobacco flavors. Hammering tannins suggest decanting and/or service with hearty foods.

title: Portal del Montsant 2013 Brunus Red (Montsant)
description: Although this Carignan-Garnacha blend smells gritty and not as ripe as vintages like 2012 and 2011, it is fresh and full in feel, with grippy tannins. Flavors of blackened spice, plum and berry fruits finish full, fleshy and a touch hot. Drink through 2019.

title: Pratesi 2014 Carmione  (Carmignano)
description: This blend of 70% Sangiovese, 20% Cabernet Sauvignon and 10% Merlot suggests black-skinned fruit and underbrush on the nose. The straightforward palate offers black plum, tobacco and clove flavors, with a firm tannic structure. Enjoy through 2019.

title: Peter Lehmann 2014 Potrait Cabernet Sauvignon (Barossa Valley)
description: Solve every steakhouse wine-ordering quandary with this bottle, which features enough structure to stand up to rare beef without any excessive weight. Hints of vanilla and dark chocolate add depth and interest to the red currant fruit, while fine, dusty tannins clean up the finish. Drink now–2023.

title: Elderton 2010 Ashmead Single Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Barossa)
description: This wine ticks all the boxes, but just lacks the excitement and drama to take it to the next level. Smoke and vanilla notes add interest to the juicy, easy-to-drink cassis fruit. There's ample but not too much weight on the palate. Supple tannins. Perhaps it just needs additional cellaring time to warrant the price, although it doesn't come across as needing it in the structural sense.

title: Etablissements Thunevin 2014 Mauvais Garçon  (Bordeaux)
description: Named after Jean-Luc Thunevin's reputation as being the bad boy of Saint-Emilion (because he broke into the hallowed aristocracy), the wine is produced from his own vines. It is a rich wine, full of great ripe fruits and dark tannins, concentrated and with some aging potential. Drink from 2018.

title: Il Palagio 2015 When We Dance  (Chianti)
description: This fragrant, red cherry- and sage-scented Chianti is made from organically grown Sangiovese, Canaiolo and Colorino. The easygoing palate delivers raspberry, redcurrant and leather notes, framed by smooth tannins and fresh acidity. It's meant to be enjoyed young.

title: Goulée 2014 Goulée de Cos d'Estournel  (Médoc)
description: A smooth and ripe wine produced by the team of Cos d'Estournel. It is full and rich with black-plum fruits and velvet tannins. With fine acidity at the back, it has kept its freshness. Drink from 2022.

title: Fattoria Torre a Cona 2013 Riserva  (Chianti Colli Fiorentini)
description: This enjoyable all-Sangiovese wine offers black cherry, tilled earth and new leather aromas. The savory palate delivers red plum flavors accented by cinnamon and clove, framed in lithe tannins. Enjoy through 2019.

title: Le Farnete 2014  Carmignano
description: Made of 80% Sangiovese and 20% Cabernet Sauvignon, this evokes ripe strawberry and baking spice on the nose. The palate is accessible despite chewy tannins, delivering black plum and pipe tobacco flavors. Enjoy through 2019.

title: Domaine Ostertag 2015 Barriques Pinot Blanc (Alsace)
description: The lovely and lively citrus-inflected nose of pear is very inviting. The palate comes across as more earthy and rounded. The body is light and easy, but has a subtle moreish texture.

title: Domaine Schoffit 2015 Vieilles Vignes Chasselas (Alsace)
description: There is a yeasty rounded freshness on the nose. The palate is also pervaded by pleasantly creamy fresh yeast notes. Again, this is about texture rather than power. This is made from one of the few vineyards of Chasselas, a rather neutral variety, that still exists in Alsace. It's a light-bodied wine made for the table and, dare I say it, for quenching thirst.

title: Donne Fittipaldi 2013  Bolgheri Superiore
description: A blend of 30% Cabernet Sauvignon, 30% Merlot, 30% Cabernet Franc and 10% Petit Verdot, this shows ripe black plum, toast and roasted coffee on the nose. The robust palate tastes of prune, graphite and espresso, dusted with tannin. An alcoholic heat is also evident. Enjoy soon to catch the remaining fruit.

title: Dopff & Irion 2015 Crustacés White (Alsace)
description: Wonderfully pure apple freshness creates a totally fruity and appetizing nose. The palate is fruity and really fresh. This is full of life and primary aromas, backed by a lovely apple-peel texture. The finish is dry, whistle-clean and perfectly fresh. Drink soon.
